ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] H3 - annoying interactive "self-tests" during mvn build
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for the report; the coded-default (in the absence of any operator setting) for the CrawlController pauseAtStart setting recently changed to true --

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] H3 - annoying interactive "self-tests" during
 mvn build
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=tHyHduvZGCENkXxtzy5F-d0PJXZybXjOUJrOz2pfWloK
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Thanks for the report; the coded-default (in the absence of any operator 
setting) for the CrawlController 'pauseAtStart' setting recently changed 
to 'true' -- meaning that operators should manually unpause after 
launch, or have their job configurations set this to be false. The 
selftest configurations hadn't been updated, resulting in the behavior 
you saw. This should be fixed now.

Our automatic tests were hung -- so the problem was evident on the 
dedicated build machine, but hadn't generated a failure notice.

If running from the latest SVN, you may want to watch the build machine 
<http://builds.archive.org:8081/continuum/servlet/continuum/target/ProjectBuilds.vm/view/ProjectBuilds/id/76> 
and the source-repository commits list 
<http://sourceforge.net/mailarchive/forum.php?forum=archive-crawler-cvs> 
for major or destabilizing changes before grabbing updated code.

Also, just yesterday I added a new wiki page for highlighting 
operator-visible changes between releases (before release notes or other 
documentation is ready). See:

http://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/H3+Dev+Notes+for+Crawl+Operators

This is in addition to the issue reports like the JIRA 'roadmap', 
showing the next planned releases and issues intended/fixed for each:

http://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER?report=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project:roadmap-panel

- Gordon @ IA

progre55 wrote:
> Hi people!
> 
> Today, after another svn update, I tried to "re-install" heritrix 3 by calling "mvn install". However, I noticed that there have been introduced some interactive tests :) not sure if it's on purpose or not, but the test creates a job called "selftest-job" and pauses it. The only way I found to continue the build, was to open the job (https://localhost:8443/engine/job/selftest-job) on browser, log in by the password provided during the creation of the job in the terminal, and unpause it. oh and this happens about 10-15 times! =)
> 
> Gordon, not sure if that's done on purpose, but could you try to fix that, please? :)
> 
> Thanks in advance :)
> 
> cheers,
> Ikrom (saplo.com) 
>
